titles.title: Mäzmur, Antiphones for Sundays of the year / Dǝggwa, Antiphonary / Unidentified chant / Zǝmmare, Eucharistic hymns

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäzmur, Antiphones for Sundays of the year (fols. 3ra-39ra l.17) - Table of halleluiatic chants (fols. 36va-39ra) II) Dǝggwa, Antiphonary (fols. 39ra l.18-57vb), incomplete - Dǝggwa, Antiphonary (from the feast of St. John the Baptist to St. Stephan) (fols. 39ra l.18-42vb) - Dǝggwa, Antiphonary (from the feast of St. Michael to St. Cyriacus) (fols. 43ra-57vb) III) Unidentified chant (fols. 58ra-60rb), incomplete I) Mäzmur, Antiphones for Lent (fols. 62ra-66va l.17) II) Dǝggwa, Antiphonary (fols. 66va l.18-70rb), incomplete - Dǝggwa, Antiphonary (from the feast of St. Michael to the Righteous Ones) (fols. 66va l.18-69va l.4) - Dǝggwa, Antiphonary (from the Covenant of Mercy to St. George) (fols. 69va l.5-70rb) IV) Zǝmmare, Eucharistic hymns (fols. 71ra-76ra)
Additiones 1-3.

copyists.copyist: The scribe’s signature (s. Additio 2) mentions Yämanä Bǝrhan as the scribe of the text on fols. 3ra-39ra l.17 (hand a).

dcomments.dcomment: 19th cent. All quires date to approximately the same period.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is resewn. The front board is cracked. There are two holes of a considerable size in the back board. The bottom margin of fols. 68-79 is damaged. Tears are carefully amended on fols. 58, 61, 76, 78.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine folds of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

inks.ink: Black, red (strong vermilion: fols. 3ra-37vb, 69va-70ra; vivid vermilion: fols. 39rb-42vb; strong amaranth: fols. 38ra-57v)

squires.squire:
A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 12r-26v) – V(8/fols. 27r-34v) – VI(8/fols. 35r-42v) – VII(6/fols. 43r-48v) – VIII(9; s.l.: 1, stub before 2/fols. 49r-57v) – IX(4/fols. 58r-61v) – <X(6/fols.62r-67v) – XI(3; s.l.: 1, no stub; 2, no stub; 3, no stub /fols.68r-67v)> – <XII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 4, stub after 4; 5, stub after 3; 6, stub after 2/fols.71r-78v)>.
All quires date to approximately the same period. Quire XI contains three loose fols. Fols. of quire XII are shorter, of different quality and have fewer ruling lines.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible (in the centrefolds of the quires). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre; hand b: mediocre; hand c: rather fine; hand d: rather fine.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: It seems that a few hands were involved in writing the Ms. but their precise number is difficult to determine. Hand a: fols. 3ra-39ra l.17; the script is slightly left-sloping and irregular in size (towards the end it diminishes). Hand b: fols. 28vb, 36rb, 39ra l.18-60rb, 62ra-63rb l.9, 71ra-76ra; very irregular (slightly left or right sloping) some letters have hairlines (e.g., ን, ግ, ዝ, መ, ተ, ር). Hand c: 63rb l.9-69va l.4; fairly regular, some letters have hairlines (e.g., ለ, ሐ, ሰ, ቀ). Hand d: fols. 69va l.5-70rb; slender, broadly spaced letters of angular shape, strongly pronounced shading.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements. Text I Two initial lines on the incipit page; a few lines, alternating with black lines, on fol. 18r; names of sections (mäzmur) preceded or followed by feast names or dates; names of antiphons and their abbreviations followed by initial words or letters (e.g., zä-ʾamlakiyä, ʿǝzl, śäläst, sälam, bä-5-tu, ʾabun, maḫlet, yǝtbaräk); names of other chants (e.g., mǝlṭan); musical notation signs: intratextual (e.g., ḥaḍä, ʿararay, bä-zema, nahu) and marginal (entire or elements); elements of the Table of halleluiatic chants. Text II Names of sections and their abbreviations (wazema); names of antiphons and their abbreviations (e.g., maḫlet, mäzmur, śäläst, sälam, bä-5-tu, ʾabun, ʾaryam, ʾǝsmä lä-ʿaläm, yǝtbaräk, ʿǝzl); names of other chants (e.g., mǝlṭan); musical notation: intratextual signs (e.g., ʿararat, ʾak, bä-ze, qalä ʾawadi) and elements of marginal signs. Text III Two initial lines on the incipit page; names of sections (zǝmmare) followed by feast names; word ḫǝbǝst “eucharistic bread”.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Some of the abbreviations used throughout the text: ም፡/ምል፡/ምልጣ፡ for ምልጣን፡ ማኅ፡ for ማኅሌት፡ ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ አም፡/ዘአምላ፡ for ዘአምላኪየ፡ ይት፡/ይትባ፡ for ይትባረክ፡ አቡ፡ for አቡን፡ እስ፡ for እስመ፡ ለዓለም፡ በዜ፡ for በዜማ፡ አራ፡/አራራ፡ for አራራይ፡ ዕዝ፡ for ዕዝል፡ ዋ፡ for ዋዜማ፡ ዝማ፡ for ዝማሬ፡ እግዚአ: for እግዚአብሔር: ሃ፡ for ሃሌሉያ፡ Repeated versicles are often written in an abbreviated form, e.g., መን፤ ግብ፤ stands for መንከር፡ ግብሩ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ ዘላዕለ፡ ኵሉ፡; (fol. 7va l.16); ፤ተ፤. stands for ተንሥአ፡ ወአንሥአ፡ ኵሎ፡ ሙታነ፡ (fol. 21vb l8).

additional.cont: Fol. 1v: Excerpt from Mäzmur, Antiphones for seasons of the year.
additional.det: The excerpt is carelessly written in the same hand as Additio 3.

additional.cont: Fol. 39ra: Scribe’s signature.
additional.tran:
Fol. 39ra: Mäzmurat for Sundays have been completed in God’s peace, Amen.
His scribe (is) rəˀəsä däbr (the Head of the Monastery) Yämanä Bərhan.
additional.det: The note is written in the main hand. It mentions Yämanä Bǝrhan, rǝʾǝsä däbr (the Head of the Monastery), as the scribe.

additional.cont: Fol. 70v: Excerpt from the beginning of Zǝmmare, Eucharistic hymns.
additional.det: The excerpt is carelessly written in the same hand as Additio 1.

extras.extra: - Tämälläs-signs, in the shape of a cross, indicate the place where the omissions, written in the margins, belong: fols.14ra l.16, 16rb l.16, 24ra l.17, 25vb l.6, 34ra l.10, 66vb l.9, 67va l.3, 67va l.15. - Name of the feast zä-Yoḥannǝs “of John” (the Baptist) is written in the upper margin of fol. 36rb. - Passages omitted in the main text are written in the margins, in the main hand: fols. 6vb, 9va, 15rb, 15vb, 28vb, 31va, 36vb. - In Text III there are unfilled spaces left for rubrication. - Corrections written interlineally: fols. 7ra, 7vb. - A few lines are left blank on fols. 42ra, 53ra, 63ra. - Pen trials: fols. 1v, 61v. - Writing exercises: fols. 1r, 2r, 23r.

frames.frame: Fol. 3r (incipit of Text I): red ornamental band; floral motifs.
